title: Philanthropy Meets Innovation: Alessio Vinassa on Building a Better Future Through BlockTech and the Golden Circle of Giving
description: Innovation is often celebrated for its groundbreaking technologies — artificial intelligence, immersive platforms, advanced cybersecurity systems, and interconnected digital ecosystems. But for Alessio Vinassa, innovation is incomplete unless it serves people directly. title: Cristiano Ronaldo invests in Indian-origin billionaire Aravind Srinivas’s Perplexity
description: In a crossover no one saw coming, the worlds of global football stardom and cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI) collided this week as Cristiano Ronaldo officially joined Indian-origin founder Aravind Srinivas’s company, Perplexity, as an investor. Sharing the news online, Srinivas sounded thrilled about teaming up with the football icon.

title: The rise of AI reasoning models comes with a big energy tradeoff
description: Nearly all leading artificial intelligence developers are focused on building AI models that mimic the way humans reason, but new research shows these cutting-edge systems can be far more energy intensive, adding to concerns about AI's strain on power grids.

title: SC declines PIL on regulating AI use in judiciary, allows petitioner to submit suggestions to it
description: The top court said it was aware of the ill effects of artificial intelligence AI and machine learning ML tools in the judiciary, but these issues can be appropriately addressed by it on the administrative side rather than through judicial directions.

title: SoftBank's Arm plans to set up chip design facility in South Korea
description: South Korea's industry ministry and SoftBank's chip unit, Arm Holdings, have signed an agreement to strengthen the country's semiconductor and Artificial Intelligence sectors, a presidential policy adviser said on Friday.
content:
The memorandum of understanding includes a plan for Arm to set up a chip design school in the country to tap its expertise in this area, Kim Yong-beom told reporters at a briefing.
